Title: A Royal Mess
Content: On the first ever episode of Under Fire, Wesley Donehue, Phil Vangelakos, and Christiana Purves discuss Prince Harry and Megan Markle's interview with Oprah and the royal fallout, Disney and Warner Bros. recent character cancellations, Burger King's International Women's Day bumble, and more!

Title: The Devil's Been in the News
Content: In episode two of Under Fire, Wesley, Phil, and Christiana recap Lil Nas X's "satan shoes" and Nike's impending brand reputation crisis, we hear Phil's real thoughts on Rep. Matt Gaetz, and the team argues over the efficacy of Krispy Kreme's vaccination marketing stunt. Tune in to hear all this and more!

Title: Lessons Learned from an OnlyFans Mom
Content: In the third episode of Under Fire, Wes, Christiana, and Phil run down what happened in the world of crisis over the past week. From a discussion about the OnlyFans mom whose kids were expelled to a diatribe on reporters cherry picking tweets to sensationalize stories, the trio share their opinions and advice on all things crisis comms. Bottom line this episode? Never waste a crisis.

Title: "4 Score & 7 Tweets Ago"—Abe Lincoln, Probably
Content: In the fourth episode of Under Fire, Wes, Christiana, and Phil take a look at Chet Hanks' “White Boy Summer” fiasco, Demi Lovato’s fro-yo drama, a Raiders corporate tweet faux pas, and why it’s best to take a step back before you tweet.

Title: The Mark Sanford Story with Joel Sawyer
Content: In 2009, the South Carolina governor disappeared for six days. The incident and its fallout became one of SC’s biggest political crises to date. In this episode, the Under Fire hosts interview former Governor Mark Sanford’s communications director—Joel Sawyer—to hear the ins and outs of those six days, discuss the media spectacle upon the governor’s return, and get Joel’s main crisis communications takeaways from the situation.

Title: Amber Heard Said What?!
Content: On this episode of Under Fire, the crew dives into the Johnny Depp and Amber Heard trial, Rudy Giuliani on The Masked Singer, multiple Madison Cawthorn controversies, DEI advocates falsely accusing a black DJ of wearing blackface, and more.

Title: Temper Tantrums & Testicle Tanning
Content: On this episode of Under Fire, the team discusses Netflix’s recent plummet, Ezra Miller wreaking havoc, Tucker Carlson’s views on why Americans should be tanning their genitalia, and more.

Title: The Elon Musk Hour
Content: This week on Under Fire, the crew dives into the controversy surrounding Cam Newton’s comments about women, Madison Cawthorn facing GOP backlash, Elon Musk’s Twitter takeover, and more.

Title: Is the Peloton Cult Stronger than a PR Crisis?
Content: In this week’s episode of Under Fire, Wes, Christiana, and Phil discuss how Peloton could’ve avoided the heat they’re getting with the recent recall, Facebook’s Oversight Board’s decision on Trump’s Facebook ban and #DeleteFacebook-gate, Joe Rogan’s opinion on vaccines for different age groups, and more!

Title: Healing the World with Comedy
Content: On this episode of Under Fire, Wes, Phil, and Christiana discuss Will Smith’s smack heard 'round the world, the new Oscars criteria for award eligibility, Whoopi Goldberg calling out the Royal family, and more.
Image Alt Text: Episode 45: Healing the World with Comedy

Title: Buying Into the Orthodoxy
Content: On this episode of Under Fire, Wes, Phil, and Christiana discuss Disney’s ongoing controversy regarding Florida’s “Don’t Say Gay” bill, Lambda Literary dropping Lauren Hough’s award nomination, Hunter Biden and his notorious laptop, and more.

Title: PR & Political Pawns
Content: On this episode of Under Fire, Wes, Phil, and Christiana dive into why a school official was fired for reading a children’s book, Tom Brady’s pump fake of retirement, Elon Musk trying to take Putin to the boxing ring, a WNBA star being detained in Russia, and more.

Title: The World Is Going To Shit
Content: On this week’s episode of Under Fire, the crew hits issues like the Pride Whopper, David Weigel’s controversial retweet, Wells Fargo fake interviews, Better.com’s CEO misleading investors, and more!

Title: Judging a Book by Its Cover
Content: On this episode of Under Fire, Wesley, Phil, and Christiana dive into Florida’s new "Don't Say Gay" bill, a Michigan candidates controversial rape analogy, Jeff Zucker’s payoff from CNN and more.
Image Alt Text: Episode 42: Judging a Book by Its Cover

Title: Pocket Media Companies
Content: On this episode of Under Fire, Wesley, Phil and Christiana discuss how today’s fast paced social media landscape has affected war propaganda and the spread of misinformation, Texas Rep. Van Taylor dropping his re-election bid over affair with ‘ISIS bride’, Phil Mickelson’s current controversy, and more.

Title: Tips From a Pollster with Brent Buchanan
Content: This week on Under Fire, Brent Buchanan, Cygnal Founder and CEO, joins the crew to discuss the ins and outs of polling, his experience with crisis communications and the best way to measure the scale of a crisis in general.
Image Alt Text: Episode 40: Tips From a Pollster with Brent Buchanan

Title: Straight Up Mental Toughness
Content: On this episode of Under Fire, Wesley, Phil, and Christiana are joined by special guest Brian Athey as they discuss Joe Rogan’s continued controversies, the Canadian trucker protests, the Super Bowl halftime show, and more.

Title: Let Stupidity Speak for Itself
Content: On this episode of Under Fire, Wesley, Phil, and Christiana dive into the recent Whoopi Goldberg controversy, the White House praising Spotify's new Covid disclaimers and Joe Rogan's response, Kanye spreading rumors about Pete Davison, the CNN President Jeff Zucker's resignation, and more.
Image Alt Text: Episode 38: Let Stupidity Speak for Itself

Title: Don't Serve Cold Food with Emily Bergh
Content: On this episode of Under Fire, Wesley and Christiana are joined by PR professional and entrepreneur Emily Bergh where they discuss the fast paced nature of crisis communications and Emily's experience in the field.

Title: The Martyrs of Reddit
Content: This week on Under Fire, Wesley, Phil, and Christiana discuss Neil Young pulling his music from Spotify because of Joe Rogan, a Merrill Lynch advisor who was fired over a smoothie, Reddit moderators guest starring on Fox News and Disney’s new Snow White scandal.

Title: Conspiracy Theorists are Winning
Content: On this episode of Under Fire, the crew discusses Carhartt employee COVID mandates, the Joss Whedon allegations, Britney Spears' response to Jamie Lynn's interviews, the 5G rollout, One American News, and more.

Title: Winners Bet on Themselves
Content: This week on Under Fire, Wesley, Phil and Christiana discuss employers handling the everchanging COVID mandates, Prince Andrew's royal PR scandal, the Rand Paul and Anthony Fauci interview, Stetson Bennett on Good Morning America and more.

Title: The Domino Effect
Content: On this episode of Under Fire, the crew discusses how the media and big pharma are handling the new Covid outbreak, Antonio Brown's recent scandal, the rise of podcasts over traditional media, Matt Damon's crypto commercial and more.

Title: Super Scandals: No Redemption
Content: This week on Under Fire, Wesley, Phil and Christiana discuss the James Franco fiasco, the Kelloggs strikes, Alberto Salazar and more.

Title: Death by a Thousand Cuts
Content: On this episode of Under Fire, Wesley, Phil and Christiana analyze the various Peloton scandals, the tragic Amazon warehouse incident, Kroger’s vaccination policies and more.

Title: r/How Not to Fire Someone
Content: On this week's episode of Under Fire, Wesley, Phil and Christiana dive into the Better.com zoom scandal, Jussie Smollette’s false allegations, Alec Baldwin’s controversial apology and more.
